fcc_110_missing_row_1x2.name: fcc_110_missing_row_1x2
fcc_110_missing_row_1x2.description: This is the (2x1) reconstruction for the fcc (110)                     slab, also known as the missing-row reconstruction.
fcc_110_missing_row_1x2.reference: Zhang, J. M., Zhang, M. Y., & Xu, K. W. (2009). Missing row reconstruction on                     three low index surfaces of ten FCC metals. Crystal Research and Technology, 44(3), 275–280.

fcc_100_missing_row_1x1.name: fcc_100_missing_row_1x1
fcc_100_missing_row_1x1.description: This is the (2x1) reconstruction for the fcc (100)                     slab, also known as the missing-row reconstruction.
fcc_100_missing_row_1x1.reference: Zhang, J. M., Zhang, M. Y., & Xu, K. W. (2009). Missing row reconstruction on                     three low index surfaces of ten FCC metals. Crystal Research and Technology, 44(3), 275–280.

fcc_111_missing_row_1x2.name: fcc_111_missing_row_1x2
fcc_111_missing_row_1x2.description: This is the (2x1) reconstruction for the fcc (111)                     slab, also known as the missing-row reconstruction.
fcc_111_missing_row_1x2.reference: Zhang, J. M., Zhang, M. Y., & Xu, K. W. (2009). Missing row reconstruction on                     three low index surfaces of ten FCC metals. Crystal Research and Technology, 44(3), 275–280.

fcc_111_adatom_t_1x1.name: fcc_111_adatom_t_1x1
fcc_111_adatom_t_1x1.description: This is the (1x1) reconstruction for the fcc (111)                     slab on the top (t) site.
fcc_111_adatom_t_1x1.reference: Crljen, Z., Lazic, P., Sokcevic, D., & Brako, R. (2003).                     Relaxation and reconstruction on (111) surfaces of Au, Pt, and Cu.                     Physical Review B, 68(19), 195411.

fcc_111_adatom_h_1x1.name: fcc_111_adatom_h_1x1
fcc_111_adatom_h_1x1.description: This is the (1x1) reconstruction for the fcc (111)                     slab on the hcp (h) site.
fcc_111_adatom_h_1x1.reference: Crljen, Z., Lazic, P., Sokcevic, D., & Brako, R. (2003).                     Relaxation and reconstruction on (111) surfaces of Au, Pt, and Cu.                     Physical Review B, 68(19), 195411.

fcc_111_adatom_ft_1x1.name: fcc_111_adatom_ft_1x1
fcc_111_adatom_ft_1x1.description: This is the (1x1) reconstruction for the fcc (111)                     slab with an adatom between the fcc and top (ft) site.
fcc_111_adatom_ft_1x1.reference: Crljen, Z., Lazic, P., Sokcevic, D., & Brako, R. (2003).                     Relaxation and reconstruction on (111) surfaces of Au, Pt, and Cu.                     Physical Review B, 68(19), 195411.

fcc_111_adatom_ht_1x1.name: fcc_111_adatom_ht_1x1
fcc_111_adatom_ht_1x1.description: This is the (1x1) reconstruction for the fcc (111)                     slab with an adatom between the hcp and top (ht) site.
fcc_111_adatom_ht_1x1.reference: Crljen, Z., Lazic, P., Sokcevic, D., & Brako, R. (2003).                     Relaxation and reconstruction on (111) surfaces of Au, Pt, and Cu.                     Physical Review B, 68(19), 195411.

fcc_111_adatom_bridge_1x1.name: fcc_111_adatom_bridge_1x1
fcc_111_adatom_bridge_1x1.description: This is the (1x1) reconstruction for the fcc (111)                     slab with an adatom on the bridge site.
fcc_111_adatom_bridge_1x1.reference: Crljen, Z., Lazic, P., Sokcevic, D., & Brako, R. (2003).                     Relaxation and reconstruction on (111) surfaces of Au, Pt, and Cu.                     Physical Review B, 68(19), 195411.

bcc_100_zigzag_rt2xrt2.name: bcc_100_zigzag_rt2xrt2
bcc_100_zigzag_rt2xrt2.description: This is the (rt2xrt2) reconstruction for the body-centered (100)                     slab. The surface sites are arranged in a zig-zag pattern along the diagonal of                     the primitive slab.
bcc_100_zigzag_rt2xrt2.reference: Yonehara, K., & Schmidt, L. D. (1971). A LEED study of structures                     produced by H2 on (100) W. Surface Science, 25(2), 238–260.

diamond_100_2x1.name: diamond_100_2x1
diamond_100_2x1.description: This is the (2x1) reconstruction for the diamond (100)                     slab. The surface sites are rearranged such that they form a dimer with                     each other and two back bonds with the layer of atoms below.
diamond_100_2x1.reference: Schlier, R. E., & Farnsworth, H. E. (1959). Structure and                     Adsorption Characteristics of Clean Surfaces of Germanium and Silicon.                     The Journal of Chemical Physics, 30(4), 917.

diamond_110_1x1.name: diamond_110_1x1
diamond_110_1x1.description: This is the (1x1) reconstruction for the diamond (110)                     slab. The surface sites are rearranged such that they form a chain with                     each other and the layer of atoms below.
diamond_110_1x1.reference: Schlier, R. E., & Farnsworth, H. E. (1959). Structure and                     Adsorption Characteristics of Clean Surfaces of Germanium and Silicon.                     The Journal of Chemical Physics, 30(4), 917.

diamond_111_1x2.name: diamond_111_1x2
diamond_111_1x2.description: This is the (1x2) reconstruction for the diamond (111)                     slab. The surface sites are rearranged such that they form a pi-bonded chain.
diamond_111_1x2.reference: A. Stekolnikov, J. Furthmuller, F. Bechstedt, Absolute surface                      energies of group-IV semiconductors: Dependence on orientation                      and reconstruction, Phys. Rev. B. 65 (2002) 1-10.
